sentence.Network_en: At first, he was blissfully unaware of the conspiracy against him.
sentence.Network_cn: 起初，他幸好不知道那些针对他的阴谋。

sentence.Network_en: Did you ever swallow the conspiracy theory about Kennedy?
sentence.Network_cn: 你有没有轻信过有关肯尼迪总统遇刺的阴谋论？

sentence.Network_en: He suspects there's a conspiracy to cover up the crime.
sentence.Network_cn: 他怀疑有人密谋掩盖犯罪事实。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新东方GRE词汇 - 豆丁网 ... consonance ? n. 一致,调和 conspiracy ? n. 共谋, 阴谋 constitute ? vt. 构成,任命.
新东方GRE词汇 - 豆丁网 ... consonance ? n. 一致,调和 conspiracy ? n. 共谋, 阴谋 constitute ? vt. 构成,任命.
英语词根词缀记忆法_百度文库 ... intimate 亲密的) conspiracy n 同谋 (con 共同+.
The evidence implicates many people in this conspiracy ., 谋反的证据将许多人牵连了进去.

list.abs: He orchestrated a conspiracy to let terrorists acquire stolen nerve gas ., 他策划了一个阴谋协助恐怖分子取得神经毒气.
Mr White got embroiled in that political conspiracy ., 怀特先生被卷进了那起政治阴谋.
大阴谋 (The conspiracy) 电影原声你跳我跳笨猪跳 (Lover’s Gambit) 电影原声妖夜 (Dogfight Over Shache) 电影原声夺命烦音.
they made their preparations to frustrate the conspiracy ., 他们作好准备挫败这个阴谋.

jx.jx_en_mean: an agreement to say nothing about an issue that should be generally known
jx.jx_cn_mean: 保持缄默协定；攻守同盟

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French conspiracie, alteration of Old French conspiration, based on Latin conspirare 'agree, plot' (see conspire)

entry.def: Conspiracy is the secret planning by a group of people to do something illegal.

example.ex: Seven men, all from Bristol, admitted conspiracy to commit arson...
example.tran: 7个人都来自布里斯托尔，他们承认了合谋纵火。

example.ex: He believes there probably was a conspiracy to kill President Kennedy in 1963.
example.tran: 他认为1963年肯尼迪总统遇刺身亡可能是一个阴谋。

entry.def: A conspiracy is an agreement between a group of people which other people think is wrong or is likely to be harmful.

example.ex: It's all part of a conspiracy to dispense with the town centre all together and move everything out to Meadowhall...
example.tran: 彻底抛开市中心而把所有东西都搬到梅多霍尔购物中心，这完全是一场阴谋的一部分。

example.ex: There was no evidence to link the brigade to any conspiracy against Mr Bush.
example.tran: 没有证据表明这帮人对布什先生图谋不轨。

entry.def: If there is a conspiracy of silence about something, people who know about it have agreed that they will not talk publicly about it, although it would probably be a good thing if people in general knew about it.

example.ex: Detectives have run into a conspiracy of silence in the tight-knit communities of the peninsula.
example.tran: 侦探们犯了难，半岛上各个群体抱成一团，达成了保持缄默的密约。

means.word_mean: 1. a secret agreement between two or more people to perform an unlawful act
2. a plot to carry out some harmful or illegal act (especially a political plot)
3. a group of conspirators banded together to achieve some harmful or illegal purpose

auth_sentence.content: Remember, facts are part of the liberal conspiracy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Remember, facts are part of the liberal conspiracy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Remember, facts are part of the liberal conspiracy.

auth_sentence.content: The operation came to eerily resemble the Trujillo conspiracy.
auth_sentence.res_content: The operation came to eerily resemble the Trujillo conspiracy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The operation came to eerily resemble the Trujillo conspiracy.

auth_sentence.content: There is still a conspiracy of silence surrounding death.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is still a conspiracy of silence surrounding death.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is still a conspiracy of silence surrounding death.

stems_affixes.word_buile: celib未婚+acy……性质,状态→n.独身[主义]
conspire阴谋,共谋+acy……性质,状态→n.阴谋,密谋,共谋
contum反叛+acy……性质,状态→n.抗命,不服从
fall错+acy……性质,状态→n.谬误,错误
intim亲密+acy……性质,状态→n.亲密,亲密的言行
in进入+tric=trifle琐碎事+acy……性质,状态→进入琐碎的状态→错综复杂
pirate海盗,盗印者+acy……性质,状态→piracy

stems_affixes.value_cn: 至高无上,最高权力,霸权
stems_affixes.word_buile: supreme极度的,极大的+acy……性质,状态→n.至高无上,最高权力,霸权

stems_affixes.value_cn: 热心的,积极的,有抱负的
stems_affixes.word_buile: aspire[v.[to,after]渴望,追求,有志于]+ing表形容词→adj.热心的,积极的,有抱负的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 精神饱满的;生机勃勃的
stems_affixes.word_buile: spirit精神+ed……的→adj.精神饱满的;生机勃勃的
spirit精神+ual……的→adj.精神[上]的,心灵的
aspire渴望+ation表名词→n.渴望,热望
conspire[v.阴谋,同谋,谋叛]+acy表名词→n.阴谋,密谋,共谋
expire[v.期满,[期限]终止;呼气;断气,死亡]+ation表名词→n.期满,终止
inspire[v.鼓舞,激起;使产生灵感]+ation表名词→n.灵感;鼓舞,激励
perspire[v.出汗]+ation结果→n.出汗
respire[v.呼吸]+ation表名词→n.呼吸
spir呼吸,精神+it名词→n.精神;志气;[n.]情绪,心情;[n.]酒精
a加强+spir呼吸,精神+e→看到希望的东西加强呼吸→渴望,追求
con共同+spir呼吸+e→同呼吸→同谋
dis去掉+pirit=spirit精神→去掉精神→使沮丧

stems_affixes.value_cn: 期满,[期限]终止;呼气;断气,死亡
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+pire=spir呼吸→有出气没进气→断气
in进入+spir呼吸,精神+e→吸气进去→引申为鼓励
per全部+spir呼吸+e→全身呼吸→出汗
re再次+spir呼吸,精神+e→v.呼吸
trans改变,交流+spir呼吸,精神+e→互相呼吸→transpire泄漏

sentences.en: The men were found guilty of conspiracy to murder.
sentences.cn: 这些人被裁决犯有阴谋杀人罪。

jushi.english: We heard of his implication in a conspiracy.
jushi.chinese: 我们听说他被牵连进叛乱案中。

jushi.english: This maneuver of his is a diabolical conspiracy.
jushi.chinese: 他这一手是一个居心叵测的大阴谋。

jushi.english: The men were found guilty of conspiracy to murder.
jushi.chinese: 这些人被裁决犯有阴谋杀人罪。
